meanings.definition: To create new words or expressions.
meanings.sent1: She neologizes by inventing fun words to use with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The author often neologizes to add creativity to her stories.
meanings.sent3: The comedian neologizes during his stand-up routine, making the audience laugh with his made-up words.
meanings.sent4: Her mind neologizes constantly, forming a unique language all her own.
meanings.sent5: Neologizing brings a fresh and exciting twist to communication.

meanings.definition: To introduce new words or terms into a language.
meanings.sent1: He neologizes by incorporating slang words from different cultures into his speech.
meanings.sent2: The linguist neologizes to keep up with the evolving nature of language.
meanings.sent3: The teacher neologizes in the classroom, teaching students the latest vocabulary trends.
meanings.sent4: His writing neologizes the language, blending old and new words seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: Neologizing enriches language by embracing change and innovation.
